H0.text: A cloud forming is the natural event that would take the longest time to happen.

H1.text: A mountain forming is the natural event that would take the longest time to happen.

H2.text: A pond evaporating is the natural event that would take the longest time to happen.

H3.text: A river flooding its banks is the natural event that would take the longest time to happen.

A4.text: The critical duration of intense rainfall might be only a few minutes for roof and parking lot drainage structures, while cumulative rainfall over several days would be critical for river basins.

A5.text: The flow rate increased from about 50 to 1,500 cubic feet per second in just one minute.
